snippet: Alabama’s capital is dotted with markers commemorating aspects of the civil rights movement and the Civil War, but until now very few had taken note of the city’s role in the slave trade.
abstract: Equal Justice Initiative will unveil three new markers that will be placed around Montgomery, Ala, describing city's historical role in the domestic slave trade; organization argues that a realistic understanding of slavery is essential to grasping the Civil War and the Civil Rights Movement.
lead_paragraph: Alabama’s capital is dotted with markers commemorating aspects of the civil rights movement and the Civil War, but until now very few had taken note of the city’s role in the slave trade.

headline.main: Before the Battles and the Protests, the Chains
headline.print_headline: Before the Battles and the Protests, the Chains
